normalised: Automotive: Fuel Efficiency Gains Focus in two thousand and twenty four

unnormalised: New Delhi, Oct 26th - Automakers in India are placing increased emphasis on fuel efficiency, driven by rising fuel costs and evolving consumer preferences. Dr. Sharma from IIT Madras highlights that improved engine technology and lightweight materials are key factors.
normalised: New Delhi, October twenty sixth - Automakers in India are placing increased emphasis on fuel efficiency, driven by rising fuel costs and evolving consumer preferences. Doctor Sharma from I I T Madras highlights that improved engine technology and lightweight materials are key factors.

unnormalised: "Modern engines incorporate direct injection and turbocharging, enhancing power output while using less fuel," he explained. Companies like Maruti Suzuki and Tata Motors are investing heavily in R&D to improve km/l figures.
normalised: "Modern engines incorporate direct injection and turbocharging, enhancing power output while using less fuel," he explained. Companies like Maruti Suzuki and Tata Motors are investing heavily in R and D to improve kilometer per liter figures.

unnormalised: Beyond engine improvements, aerodynamic designs and reduced vehicle weight contribute significantly. The average Indian consumer is now actively seeking vehicles offering better mileage, with many prioritizing fuel efficiency over sheer power.
normalised: Beyond engine improvements, aerodynamic designs and reduced vehicle weight contribute significantly. The average Indian consumer is now actively seeking vehicles offering better mileage, with many prioritizing fuel efficiency over sheer power.

unnormalised: The recent Auto Expo showcased several models boasting fuel efficiency figures exceeding 25 km/l. With petrol prices hovering around Rs. 100 per liter, this trend is expected to continue, impacting purchasing decisions and incentivizing further innovation in the automotive sector across India, from Kashmir to Kanyakumari, even influencing interior design towards lighter materials reducing overall weight, like using 300 sq ft of fabric instead of leather.
normalised: The recent Auto Expo showcased several models boasting fuel efficiency figures exceeding twenty five kilometer per liter. With petrol prices hovering around rupees one hundred per liter, this trend is expected to continue, impacting purchasing decisions and incentivizing further innovation in the automotive sector across India, from Kashmir to Kanyakumari, even influencing interior design towards lighter materials reducing overall weight, like using three hundred square feet of fabric instead of leather.
